 3 namespace UserFrosting;
 4 
 5 /**
 6  * User session middleware.
 7  *
 8  * Handles creation of the authenticated user session at the beginning of each request.
 9  * @package UserFrosting
10  * @author Alex Weissman
11  * @link http://www.userfrosting.com/
12  */
13 class UserSession extends \Slim\Middleware {
14 
15     /**
16      * Call middleware.
17      *
18      * @return void
19      */
20     public function call() {
21         // TODO: Register error-handlers?   
22         
23         // Attach as hook.
24         $this->app->hook('slim.before', array($this, 'setup'));
25 
26         // Call next middleware.
27         $this->next->call();
28     }
29     
30     /**
31      * Sets up the session for the currently logged-in user, trying to re-establish a session for "remember-me" users who have been logged out,
32      * or creates a guest user object if no one is logged in.
33      */     
34     public function setup(){       
35         try {
36             // Initialize RememberMe
37             $storage = new \Birke\Rememberme\Storage\PDO($this->app->remember_me_table);
38             $storage->setConnection(\Illuminate\Database\Capsule\Manager::connection()->getPdo());
39             $this->app->remember_me = new \Birke\Rememberme\Authenticator($storage);
40             // Set cookie name
41             $this->app->remember_me->setCookieName($this->app->config('session')['name'] . "-rememberme");
42             
43             // Change cookie path
44             $cookie = $this->app->remember_me->getCookie();
45             $cookie->setPath("/");
46             $this->app->remember_me->setCookie($cookie);             
47             
48             // Determine if we are already logged in (user exists in the session variable)
49             if(isset($_SESSION["userfrosting"]["user_id"]) && ($_SESSION["userfrosting"]["user_id"] != null)) {       
50                 
51                 // Load the user.  If they don't exist any more, throw an exception.
52                 if (!($this->app->user = User::find($_SESSION["userfrosting"]["user_id"])))
53                     throw new AccountInvalidException();
54                 
55                 //error_log("Current user id is " . $this->app->user->id);
56                 
57                 // Check, if the Rememberme cookie exists and is still valid.
58                 // If not, we log out the current session
59                 if(!empty($_COOKIE[$this->app->remember_me->getCookieName()]) && !$this->app->remember_me->cookieIsValid()) {
60                     //error_log("Session expired. logging out...");
61                     $this->app->remember_me->clearCookie();
62                     throw new AuthExpiredException();
63                 }
64             // If not, try to login via RememberMe cookie
65             } else {
66                 // Get the user id. If we can present the correct tokens from the cookie, log the user in
67                 $user_id = $this->app->remember_me->login();               
68                 if($user_id) {
69                     //error_log("Logging in via remember me for $user_id");
70                     // Load the user
71                     $this->app->user = User::find($user_id);
72                     // Update in session
73                     $_SESSION["userfrosting"]["user_id"] = $user_id;
74                     // There is a chance that an attacker has stolen the login token, so we store
75                     // the fact that the user was logged in via RememberMe (instead of login form)
76                     $_SESSION['remembered_by_cookie'] = true;
77                 } else {
78                     // If $remember_me->login() returned false, check if the token was invalid.  This means the cookie was stolen.
79                     if($this->app->remember_me->loginTokenWasInvalid()) {
80                         //error_log("Cookie was stolen!");
81                         throw new AuthCompromisedException();
82                     }
83                 }
84             }
85             // Now we have an authenticated user, setup their environment
86             $this->app->setupAuthenticatedEnvironment();
87         } catch (\PDOException $e){
88             // If we can't connect to the DB, then we can't create an authenticated user.  That's ok if we're in installation mode.
89             error_log("Unable to authenticate user because the database is not yet initialized, invalid, or inaccessible.  Falling back to guest user.");
90             error_log($e->getTraceAsString());
91         }
92     }
93 }
